clinical_study.brief_title: Web-based Insulin Titration - An Efficacy Study
clinical_study.official_title: Web-based Insulin Titration: Improving Diabetes Care in the Netherlands. An Efficacy Study.

lead_sponsor.agency: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

clinical_study.source: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of the study is to determine whether an intensive web-based titration system, called PANDIT (Patient Assisting Net-based Diabetes Insulin Titration), is effective in improving glycaemic control in patients with diabetes mellitus type 2 using a basal insulin, compared to standard care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline after 13 weeks and after 26 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life and treatment satisfaction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline after 13 weeks and after 26 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Total contact time with study staff (and the PANDIT system, if applicable)
Proportion of subjects who reach the target of HbA1c < 7.0%
Mean change in fasting plasma glucose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline after 13 weeks and after 26 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall incidence and rate of hypoglycaemia (mild hypoglycaemia, probable hypoglycaemia, severe hypoglycaemia and relative hypoglycaemia)
Frequency of the usage of PANDIT among patients
Detection of important factors for patient compliance to internet-based self-care interventions

arm_group.description: An online web-based insulin titration algorithm to guide patients in self-titration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female between 18 and 80 years
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus (diagnosed clinically) for â‰¥ 6 months
- Once daily basal insulin therapy usage
- No restriction on HbA1c or FPG
- BMI < 40 kg/m2
- Ability to read and understand the Dutch language
- Familiarity with the Internet and use of a mobile phone
- Ability and willingness to adhere to the protocol
- Ability and willingness to use a web-based insulin self-titration system
- Confirmed written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes
- Use of systemic corticosteroid in the last three months
- Recurrent severe hypoglycaemia or hypoglycaemic unawareness
- Active proliferative diabetic retinopathy
- Any clinically significant disease or disorder
- Mental condition rendering the patient unable to understand the nature, scope and possible consequences of the study
- Working in night shifts
